subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] for Bruce Halliday - A technician request
author: Frank Ratka

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=windows-1252
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Ron,

If and when you get the chance, try this out. It is an active antenna=
 that acts as a 60' longwire. I believe Sumption may have posted this befor=
e. Ramsey Electronics is a favorite of mine so I cruise their site a lot.

=
http://www.ramseyelectronics.com/cgi-bin/commerce.exe?preadd=3Daction&key=
=3DAA7C

Regards,

Frank R.

----- Original Message ----
From: Ron Lederer =
<ronriko@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, January 9,=
 2008 8:46:19 AM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] for Bruce Halliday - A technician r=
equest










  


    
            
Thanks for the encouragement Bruce.=
  You are correct I have a rs 12-469 and I cut the pin so it scans continua=
lly when needed.   I at times used audacity on my computer to record, think=
ing that speed control would be useful to interpret messages...nice thought=
.   I like the simplicity of your suggestion to just plug the radio directl=
y into the digital recorder.  Not knowing exactly how all this goes down, I=
 thought the radio scan sounds need to mix in the room so that the techs on=
 the other side can respond.  Whatever works.  
   
  The other main questi=
on I have is regarding the radio stations I can pick up here in my part of =
Mexico, on the Yucatan.  I only get several stations during a complete scan=
 of all a.m. or f.m. channels...don' t know if that is enough.  It has been=
 suggested that I somehow can add an antenna to search for more channels, w=
hich I would attempt if it is
 really necessary.  I get mostly Spanish lang=
uage stations and an occasional station from Texas that skips across the Gu=
lf of Mexico.  Not much to scan.  Any thoughts on this?
   
  By the way, I=
 think the work you are doing is, well, extraordinary.    Like pros from an=
y other field of endeavor, you make this stuff look easy to do...not so.  T=
hanks again.   Ron L  
  
bruce halliday <paranormalinvestiga ting@hotmail.=
 com> wrote:
      Hey Ron
 L.,
 
In my experience it does not matter what =
language you recieve the signal in.
The entities are using only fragments, =
small bits and pieces of the radio signal
to form the words. Therefore it d=
oes not matter if the radio signal is in spanish 
or english or any other l=
anguage for that matter.
 
Our friends on the other side will manipulate th=
e fragments they need to communicate 
with you in the language you will und=
erstand.
 
Ron you mention that you are using an rs 690 that is not one of =
the hack model numbers 
maybe you have gotten the wrong radio model. Check =
the part number it must be a 12-469
or a 12-470 and if it is the 470 it wou=
ld have to be the older model or it could not be modified.
 
Can you verify=
 that you have modified the rs radio and that it is continually scanning wi=
thout
stopping on any one particular station?
 
Also there would be no need=
 for EVP maker or a microphone to be
 used during a session with the RS box=

all you would need is the RS box and a digital recorder, if you have the 4=
69 you would need speakers to 
record the session or plug the digital recor=
der directly into the radio.
 
Please check your equipment and how it is op=
erating and let me know so I can help you further.
Don't worry they are jus=
t waiting for you to set up the correct equipment and they will communicate=
.
 
Bruce


  Bruce Halliday 




      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
From: =
ronriko@yahoo. com
Date: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 11:16:51 -0800
Subject: [EVP-ITC] =
for Bruce Halliday - A technician request

    
  Bruce, I now have done a =
few days testing with my rs 690, evp maker, audacity, a mic, and my handhel=
d digital recorder.  Nada, nothing, zilch.  Maybe because I only get to sca=
n past 5 to 8 channels on Am or FM so I don't have enough signals to muster=
 a response.  But from what you and others with experience seem to be sayin=
g, it shouldn't matter because I will get help from someone on the other-si=
de.  Maybe they can't find me in Mexico?  Please let your techs know I am h=
ere...should be no problem with immigration papers or money exchange.  I re=
ally need help.  Ron L

bruce halliday <paranormalinvestiga ting@hotmail. c=
om> wrote:       Ann,
That may be, But I find that when I do a session mike=
 and lisa both come through but mike seems to be the more dominant one.
 
I=

 have asked that mike and lisa help in your sessions as well as other new =
researchers and they seem to comply but I think mike
is more like a supervi=
sor and delegates actions to other techs. I know that if you do not have a =
perminent tech that whatever tech
is available at the time you do your sess=
ion will be assigned to assist you. If it is lisa she is very sweet and wil=
l do her best to give you 
solid communication. I'm glad she can help.
 
Br=
uce


  Bruce Halliday 




      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
From: lisby@=
earthlink. net
Date: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 11:40:02 -0500
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] =
Re: A file from Frank's box #12 pertaining to lisby's
 technition

      I'=
m getting the thought that Lisa is bouncing around between us. She's very d=
ominant every time I run a session and I've gotten some good stuff from her=
, which I will shortly be able to post, I hope. About a week ago, I got a r=
eally extraordinary sequence that ran something along the lines of a male s=
aying, "Lisa, can you do it?" followed by a clear female voice saying, "Tes=
ting. Beginning. Ground," and then a second female voice saying "Kick." I w=
as floored.

Anyway, Lisa seems to be the driver of a lot of what is going =
on right now. Maybe she intends to work with a number of us?

Ann


  -----=

From: bruce halliday 
Sent: Jan 8, 2008 9:22 AM 
To:=
 evp-itc@yahoogroups .com 
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: A file from Frank's b=
ox #12 pertaining to lisby's technition 

        Frank,
 
I have two techs=
 that I speak with on a daily basis and one of them
is Lisa. She could poss=
ibly be contacting you with the technical info she tried to give me
yesterd=
ay.
 
Bruce



  Bruce Halliday 




      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Fro=
m: franks-boxes@ hotmail.com
Date: Tue, 8 Jan 2008 06:39:54 +0000
Subject: =
[EVP-ITC] Re: A file from Frank's box #12 pertaining to lisby's technition
=

      I've been getting Lisa too, but so far not in any segments tranfered=
 
to the PC. Even tonight I heard her,
 but not while I was taping. 

Frank=
-S
